quote: If a man has not discovered something that he will die for, he isn't fit to live.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Some people die at 25 and aren't buried until 75.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Our dead are never dead to us, until we have forgotten them.
author: George Eliot

quote: Life is hard. Then you die. Then they throw dirt in your face. Then the worms eat you. Be grateful it happens in that order.
author: David Gerrold

quote: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pike

quote: The idea is to die young as late as possible.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: And how can man die better than facing fearful odds, for the ashes of his fathers, and the temples of his Gods?
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Death is nothing, but to live defeated and inglorious is to die daily.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: When your time comes to die, be not like those whose hearts are filled with fear of death, so that when their time comes they weep and pray for a little more time to live their lives over again in a different way. Sing your death song, and die like a hero going home.
author: Tecumseh

quote: I would rather die a meaningful death than to live a meaningless life.
author: Corazon Aquino

quote: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Suicide is man's way of telling God, 'You can't fire me - I quit.'
author: Bill Maher

quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them and that is eternity.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: The dead cannot cry out for justice. It is a duty of the living to do so for them.
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quote: Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
author: Unknown

quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I intend to live forever, or die trying.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: You'll have time to rest when you're dead.
author: Robert De Niro

quote: I am prepared to meet my Maker. Whether my Maker is prepared for the great ordeal of meeting me is another matter.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I am not afraid of death, I just don't want to be there when it happens.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Don't send me flowers when I'm dead. If you like me, send them while I'm alive.
author: Brian Clough

quote: I'll sleep when I'm dead.
author: Warren Zevon

quote: We die only once, and for such a long time.
author: Moliere

quote: Millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
author: Susan Ertz

quote: I am become death, the destroyer of worlds.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with great pleasure.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Healthy children will not fear life if their elders have integrity enough not to fear death.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: If we must die, we die defending our rights.
author: Sitting Bull

quote: Dying is easy, it's living that scares me to death.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Because of indifference, one dies before one actually dies.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Always read something that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: In the long run we are all dead.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: Since the day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: If you die in an elevator, be sure to push the Up button.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: When you're dead, you're dead. That's it.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: If we lose love and self respect for each other, this is how we finally die.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Some men are alive simply because it is against the law to kill them.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Do not fear death so much but rather the inadequate life.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: It's funny how most people love the dead, once you're dead, you're made for life.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: He who doesn't fear death dies only once.
author: Giovanni Falcone

quote: When I die, I'm leaving my body to science fiction.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Death is the cure for all diseases.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I hope it is true that a man can die and yet not only live in others but give them life, and not only life, but that great consciousness of life.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

quote: I had seen birth and death but had thought they were different.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Love and death are the two great hinges on which all human sympathies turn.
author: B. R. Hayden

quote: I'm gonna live till I die.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: For death is no more than a turning of us over from time to eternity.
author: William Penn

quote: A dying man needs to die, as a sleepy man needs to sleep, and there comes a time when it is wrong, as well as useless, to resist.
author: Stewart Alsop

quote: It is not the end of the physical body that should worry us. Rather, our concern must be to live while we're alive - to release our inner selves from the spiritual death that comes with living behind a facade designed to conform to external definitions of who and what we are.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived.
author: Willa Cather
